channel.title: python on Kathy Wang
channel.description: Recent content in python on Kathy Wang

item.title: Python Demonstration
item.description: Let's explore Python! Python can use regex to pull specific parts of strings. Here, we pull all the IP addresses from 'string1.' import re string1="Jan 13 00:48:59: DROP service 68->67(udp) from 213.92.153.167 to 69.43.107.219, prefix: \"spoof iana-0/8\" \ (in: eth0 69.43.112.233(38:f8:b7:90:45:92):68 -> 217.70.100.113(00:21:87:79:9c:d9):67 UDP len:576 ttl:64) \ Jan 13 12:02:48: ACCEPT service dns from 74.125.186.208 to firewall(pub-nic-dns), prefix: \"none\" \ (in: eth0 74.125.186.208(00:1a:e3:52:5d:8e):36008 -> 140.105.63.158(00:1a:9a:86:2e:62):53 UDP len:82 ttl:38) \ Jan 13 17:44:52: DROP service 68->67(udp) from 172.
